results.snippet: Today marks the 70th anniversary of the most lopsided game in American football history, Georgia Tech's 222-0 demolition of a rag-tag squad from Cumberland College of Lebanon, Tenn., and only one of the victors is alive to tell about it. He's...
results.lead_paragraph: Today marks the 70th anniversary of the most lopsided game in American football history, Georgia Tech's 222-0 demolition of a rag-tag squad from Cumberland College of Lebanon, Tenn., and only one of the victors is alive to tell about it. He's George Griffin, who played quarterback for the 1916 Rambling Wrecks before extending his Tech career in the posts of assistant football coach, mathematics instructor, assistant dean of students, dean of students (1946-64) and now dean emeritus. Griffin, not surprisingly, is known around campus as Mr. Georgia Tech, and this Thursday he has another anniversary to celebrate. It's his 90th birthday, and the school is throwing a big bash that evening in the Griffin Ballroom of the Alumni-Faculty House. Bobby Dodd will be there, and invitations have also gone out to such alumni as Jimmy Carter, Senator Sam Nunn, the astronaut John Young, and Rear Adm. Richard Truly, director of the space shuttle program.

headline.main: Space Shuttle Atlantis Is Put On Launching Pad in Florida

results.snippet: The space shuttle Atlantis was mounted atop the launching pad here today for a series of tests, including astronaut escape drills.
results.lead_paragraph: The space shuttle Atlantis was mounted atop the launching pad here today for a series of tests, including astronaut escape drills.

results.snippet: In the manager's office in the Mets' clubhouse, Davey Johnson opened the lower right-hand drawer of his desk. ''Here they are,'' he said. As the drawer moved, eight National League baseballs rolled around. Some were cleaner than others. Some were...
results.lead_paragraph: In the manager's office in the Mets' clubhouse, Davey Johnson opened the lower right-hand drawer of his desk. ''Here they are,'' he said. As the drawer moved, eight National League baseballs rolled around. Some were cleaner than others. Some were slightly smudged with dirt or grass stains. But on each ball, the white cowhide was scuffed, as if sandpapered, in the area where the red stitches widen. ''They're all scuffed in the same spot,'' Johnson was saying now. ''All in the middle of the ball on top of the ball. I don't think that's an accident.''

results.snippet: THE Lotus Development Corporation's 1-2-3 was recognized as a work of genius when it came out in 1983. It was the first program to combine three powerful business applications - a spreadsheet, a database and graphics - and it has become an...
results.lead_paragraph: THE Lotus Development Corporation's 1-2-3 was recognized as a work of genius when it came out in 1983. It was the first program to combine three powerful business applications - a spreadsheet, a database and graphics - and it has become an indispensable tool in thousands of offices. But history has shown that genius does not often blossom until it has an interpreter. Jonson had Boswell, Holmes had Watson, and now 1-2-3 has Hal.

headline.main: Sally Ride Is Willing to Fly

results.snippet: The astronaut Sally Ride, who is working at NASA's headquarters while the space shuttle is being redesigned, said today that the agency had done a good job and that she had changed her mind about going into orbit again.   In the wake of the...
results.lead_paragraph: The astronaut Sally Ride, who is working at NASA's headquarters while the space shuttle is being redesigned, said today that the agency had done a good job and that she had changed her mind about going into orbit again. In the wake of the Challenger disaster Jan. 28, Miss Ride was widely quoted as saying she would not want to ride the shuttle.

results.snippet: Frank Lorenzo, the head of the Texas Air Corporation, was named chairman of Eastern Air Lines Inc. today in a management shake-up that strengthens his hold over the carrier.   Separately, Texas Air received the approval of a Federal bankruptcy...
results.lead_paragraph: Frank Lorenzo, the head of the Texas Air Corporation, was named chairman of Eastern Air Lines Inc. today in a management shake-up that strengthens his hold over the carrier. Separately, Texas Air received the approval of a Federal bankruptcy court to acquire the assets of Frontier Airlines Inc. for $158 million. Pending final approval of the Transportation Department, Texas Air plans to begin service to some of Frontier's routes as early as Nov. 1. In addition to electing Mr. Lorenzo, Eastern's board of directors replaced Joseph B. Leonard, president and acting chief executive, with Philip J. Bakes, 40 years old, who has been president of the Continental Airlines Corporation since 1984. Mr. Lorenzo will assume the presidency of Continental, which is owned by Texas Air.

headline.main: Setting a New Course for the Shuttle's Rockets

results.snippet: Sally K. Ride, the astronaut who was on the Presidential commission that investigated the Challenger disaster, said last week that the redesign of the shuttle's rockets is going so well that she is willing to fly again. Although the panel charged...

byline.original: By Laura Mansnerus and Katherine Robarts

results.lead_paragraph: Sally K. Ride, the astronaut who was on the Presidential commission that investigated the Challenger disaster, said last week that the redesign of the shuttle's rockets is going so well that she is willing to fly again. Although the panel charged with overseeing the changes agreed that they had ''progressed greatly,'' it indicated that the National Aeronautics and Space Administration still had a long way to go.

results.snippet: MY NAME'S SMITH-ers. People in the business call me Smithereens. ''Get Smithereens,'' is the cry you'll hear ringing through every TV station in America when they've got a three-hour movie, plus 45 commercials to fit into two hours of TV time.  ...
results.lead_paragraph: MY NAME'S SMITH-ers. People in the business call me Smithereens. ''Get Smithereens,'' is the cry you'll hear ringing through every TV station in America when they've got a three-hour movie, plus 45 commercials to fit into two hours of TV time. ''Smithers,'' they say, ''is your man when you're chopping Capra, Ford and Hitchcock to smithereens.''

results.snippet: Thousands of tons of paper have descended on the heads of heroes since Theodore Roosevelt was honored in 1910 in the first ticker-tape parade up Broadway from Battery Park to City Hall.   But the modern era has seen a decline in the paper blizzards...
results.lead_paragraph: Thousands of tons of paper have descended on the heads of heroes since Theodore Roosevelt was honored in 1910 in the first ticker-tape parade up Broadway from Battery Park to City Hall. But the modern era has seen a decline in the paper blizzards along the traditional financial district parade route.
